p.caps_html_text_node: Specifies additional options to pass to the
tool.
Splits the MOF file into language-neutral and -specific versions. (
Specifies Authority as the authority (domain name) to use when logging on to WMI. (
Adds the named MOF file to the list of files compiled during repository recovery. (
Requests that the compiler create a binary version of the MOF file with the name filename without making any modifications to the WMI repository. (
Name of the language neutral output. (
Name of the language specific output. (
Requests that the compiler not make any changes to existing classes. When this switch is used, the compile operation terminates if a class specified in the MOF file already exists.
Forces updates of classes when conflicting child classes exist.
Allows updates of classes even if there are child classes, as long as the change does not cause conflicts with child classes.
Requests that the compiler not create any new classes.
See
for more information.
Requests that the compiler load the MOF file into the namespace specified as
Extracts the localized MOF descriptions from the binary MOF when used with -ER switch. (
Extracts binary MOF from a named resource. (
Requests that the compiler perform a syntax check only and print appropriate error messages. No other option can be used with the
option.
Requests that the compiler perform a WMI syntax check
. If you select this option, you must also select the
option (
